<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-LEFT: 13.5PT">
	PART I
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">

<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Item 1. Business
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Overview
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We are a medical technology company that develops, manufactures, and markets non-invasive patient monitoring products that are vital to patient care.&#160; Our vision is simple:&#160; That no patient is harmed by undetected tissue hypoxia.&#160; To realize this vision, we design, manufacture, and distribute the FORE-SIGHT&#174; and FORE-SIGHT ELITE&#174; brand tissue oximeters and sensors.&#160; These products alert clinicians to the oxygenation levels of a patient's brain or other body tissue with a simple non-invasive sensor applied to the skin to avoid harm caused by insufficient oxygen, or hypoxia.&#160; The FORE-SIGHT product line comprised 71% of our 2015 sales from continuing operations.&#160; We also sell legacy products that we group into a category entitled Traditional Monitoring, which includes non-invasive blood pressure measurement technologies, neonatal medical disposables, and service sales.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We believe that our FORE-SIGHT tissue oximetry products place CASMED in a unique position to expand the clinical application for monitoring tissue oxygenation. Standard non-invasive parameters, such as pulse oximetry and blood pressure, provide only surrogate markers of tissue oxygen delivery.&#160; The indirect nature of these parameters forces clinicians to infer the adequacy of oxygenation in vital organs, including the brain, during medical procedures.&#160; However, data convincingly shows that clinician inferences of cerebral oxygenation during medical procedures often does not correlate with actual tissue oxygenation levels and that potentially dangerously low levels of cerebral oxygenation often go unrecognized, correlating to high levels of patient harm.&#160; Therefore, direct monitoring of cerebral oxygenation with FORE-SIGHT oximeters provides a unique and powerful tool that allows clinicians to recognize and treat potentially dangerous tissue hypoxia to avoid adverse clinical outcomes.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As clinician education and experience demonstrates that use of cerebral and tissue oximetry improves patient care, the market for these monitors should continue to expand at attractive rates as the industry penetrates what we believe is more than a $500-million addressable market.&#160; We believe the FORE-SIGHT tissue oximeter provides clinicians the most accurate and reliable readings and is well-positioned to compete in that expanding market.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 4 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Strategy Execution
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In 2015, the Company made substantial progress towards its multi-year strategic goal of focusing on FORE-SIGHT's opportunity to redefine the tissue oximetry market and transform CASMED from a low-margin commodity capital medical equipment business into a high-growth, high-margin medical disposables business.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Given the unique clinical value of FORE-SIGHT and its position as a best-in-class cerebral oximeter in an expanding market, we believe that substantial investment in the FORE-SIGHT opportunity has been and is warranted to drive increases in the Company's enterprise value over the longer term.&#160; Our FORE-SIGHT ELITE technology has significantly lower costs than the first-generation technology. As a result, our gross profit margins have increased recently.&#160; This enables us to: 1. invest those gross profits to expand, upgrade, and revitalize our FORE-SIGHT sales organization; 2. increase our marketing and clinical support; and 3. continue to reduce FORE-SIGHT product costs through prudent R&amp;D spending.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

</FONT>
	we exited our legacy vital signs monitoring business, by discontinuing our historic 740&#174; brand vital signs monitors and by divesting the 740 SELECT&#174; brand vital signs monitors in a cash-generating transaction.&#160; On March 28, 2016, we sold our neonatal intensive care disposable supplies product line for $3.35 million. Both of these transactions will allow for enhanced focus on the Company's FORE-SIGHT oximetry business.

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Description of Products and Services
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT">
	The Company reports two categories of sales within one reportable business unit.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="58D0AC780CBE4522ACAF483A3191BFA5" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">

	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Tissue Oximetry Monitoring
</FONT>
	&#8211; includes sales of the Company's FORE-SIGHT tissue oximeter monitors, sensors, and accessories.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="5EF9C3D0C3634C2A99FFA47D48F68176" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Traditional Monitoring &#8211;
</FONT>
	includes sales of the Company's legacy products comprising:&#160; (i) the OEM sales of the Company's proprietary non-invasive blood pressure technology (MAXNIBP&#174; and MAXIQ&#8482;); (ii) neonatal intensive care disposable supplies; and (iii) monitor service and repair. Effective March 28, 2016, the Company sold its neonatal intensive care disposable product line.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Tissue Oximetry Monitoring
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	CASMED's FORE-SIGHT tissue oximeter technology provides clinicians with a simple, non-invasive, quantitative measurement of oxygenation of cerebral tissue typically during surgery or critical care situations.&#160; The percentage saturation of cerebral hemoglobin with oxygen is obtained by placing a sensor on the skin on both the right and the left side of the patient's forehead. The FORE-SIGHT ELITE sensors emit five different wavelengths of infrared light that harmlessly penetrate into the cerebral tissue and are reflected back to photo-detectors in the same sensor.&#160; An exclusive algorithm then determines the percentage of hemoglobin that is saturated with oxygen in the blood of the brain tissue underlying each sensor. Through these proprietary and patented processes, FORE-SIGHT provides clinicians with an accurate, absolute numerical measure of tissue oxygenation.&#160; FORE-SIGHT can also be used to monitor the oxygenation of other tissues such as muscle and abdominal tissues in newborns weighing less than 4 kilograms.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	By non-invasively and continuously measuring absolute cerebral tissue oxygen levels, our FORE-SIGHT tissue oximeter enables clinicians to identify and quickly react to dangerously low brain oxygen levels and empowers them to provide better care.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We believe that FORE-SIGHT incorporates a combination of features that permit obtained oxygenation values to be more reliable and more accurate and, therefore, more actionable by clinicians in critical care environments.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="0144350D3AE14394AABCE006F74A6F94" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	CASMED's FORE-SIGHT ELITE monitors emit five wavelengths of light, permitting an increased level of signal acquisition, thus providing sufficient data to solve for other optical variables in the tissue sample, such as melanin in the skin, which would otherwise be confused as hemoglobin signals.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="C719051EF85143A68A50E8D24F6DA825" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	CASMED's FORE-SIGHT sensors are designed with a preferred geometry, maximizing the distance between the light source and the farthest photo-detector, thereby providing a light pathway that penetrates deeper into the tissue, giving a greater tissue sample for interrogation.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="4F2341DFDCFC4E8FBAE65D92612C17A0" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	CASMED's FORE-SIGHT patented and proprietary algorithm utilizes a combination of methods to sort out optical signals created by non-critical background tissue that otherwise confound measurement of oxygenated hemoglobin levels.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Monitors that predominantly provide trend-based values differ significantly from the FORE-SIGHT oximeter which provides absolute values.&#160; Trend-based monitors rely upon a baseline measurement from which a declination of some percentage is then considered to be an actionable "desaturation" event.&#160; However, the baseline presumes the patient's oxygenation levels are not already compromised by the introduction of anesthesia, inspired oxygen, existing cardiovascular disease, compromised physiology, or other confounding factors.&#160; Therefore, in those instances where a patient is already ill, is already being treated, or for which a single "spot check" value is sought, a valid baseline measurement may not be available.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 6 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	With FORE-SIGHT's absolute tissue oxygenation measurement, clinicians can have confidence that the value displayed is an accurate reflection of the actual tissue oxygenation to enable clinical interventions once a predetermined absolute threshold is reached (for example, if the oxygen saturation levels drop below an absolute value of 60%).
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We believe our FORE-SIGHT oximeter helps clinicians solve a serious deficit in the care of many critical care patients.&#160; Unrecognized and dangerous desaturation events occur with much greater frequency than previously known and can only be identified with the direct measurement that tissue oximeters provide.&#160; Given this evidence, we believe our best-in-class FORE-SIGHT technology continues to gain clinical adoption in new and existing accounts and is well-positioned in the market for future growth.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We launched our next-generation FORE-SIGHT ELITE Tissue Oximeter late in the third quarter of 2013, creating an inflection point for the Company.&#160; The FORE-SIGHT ELITE monitor is lighter and more portable than our prior model, includes more features, and provides for enhanced ease-of-use. New features include the ability to monitor four channels of patient data; a larger, higher contrast viewing screen; and intuitive touch-screen controls. Its revolutionary system, using five wavelengths of light to interrogate tissue under the sensor, allows the ELITE system to measure oxygenation at levels of accuracy previously not seen.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The FORE-SIGHT ELITE has also been designed for lower manufacturing and service costs, and the Company continues to execute on the strategy to enhance design and production to reduce those costs further.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Since its introduction in 2007 through the end of 2015, we have shipped a cumulative total of 1,708 FORE-SIGHT monitors to customers throughout the world, including 379 monitors shipped in 2015.&#160; The quantity of "net units shipped" that we report each fiscal quarter adds to this cumulative total and reflects the number of monitors shipped to customers less returns.&#160; The cumulative total is not affected by exchanges or monitor upgrades. Cumulative net shipments in the U.S., reported as the installed base, reached&#160;914 monitors at year-end 2015, up 26% over the prior year-end base.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	The Need for Tissue Oxygenation Monitoring
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Oxygen is necessary to keep cells viable.&#160; The brain has a very high metabolic rate, consuming approximately 20% of the body's oxygen at rest.&#160; It is the organ that is least resistant to oxygen deprivation. Lack of sufficient oxygenation in the brain causes neurologic injury such as cognitive impairment, stroke, paralysis, coma, and/or hypoxic encephalopathy.&#160; These injuries can result in severe morbidity or even death. Dangerous deficits in brain hemoglobin saturation (reflecting decreased brain oxygen levels) are termed "desaturation events" because the hemoglobin of the blood is no longer sufficiently "saturated" with oxygen molecules.&#160; Desaturations can be caused by many factors.&#160; The brain responds to insufficient levels of oxygen by increasing ventilation, cardiac output, and blood pressure in order to increase oxygen delivery.&#160; It also vasodilates to increase brain blood flow.&#160; This biologic process is called "auto-regulation."&#160; However, auto-regulation is compromised by illness, surgical intervention, trauma, and anesthesia; and neonates and children have immature auto-regulation capabilities.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Inadequate oxygen delivery to the brain can be caused by:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="4308A5A11ECD4D31BFB43C65265ABEFE" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Hypoxemia: a decrease of hemoglobin oxygen saturation in arterial blood (inadequate oxygenation of the supply);
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="496210BFB0CB40CABAD4F75CCAEAEB02" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Ischemia: a decrease in blood flow to the brain caused by inadequate cardiac output, occlusion of cerebral vessels, or increased intracranial pressure (inadequate volume of supply); and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="FF28E79EBC9A4B3F84A058D16395DC0E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 27PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Anemia: a decrease in the concentration of red blood cells in the blood (inadequate oxygen carrying capacity).
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Oxygen delivery must also match oxygen consumption related to the metabolic rate of the brain.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 7 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Most conventional monitoring is ultimately employed to assure an adequate balance between oxygen supply and demand.&#160; Reliably measuring the impact of complicated interactions among factors affecting cerebral oxygenation requires unacceptably invasive techniques.&#160; Standard parameters, such as pulse oximetry, heart rate and blood pressure determinations, capnometry, and cardiac output assessment, each provide only indirect predictions of cerebral oxygenation.&#160; From that information, a clinician can only infer
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	that a patient's brain inadequately oxygenated.&#160; Data from cerebral oximetry convincingly shows that the estimations clinicians make about cerebral oxygenation based solely on these indirect measures are frequently wrong and that threatening cerebral desaturation events occur without recognition.&#160;&#160; Thus, in many acute care settings, such as surgery, intensive care, and other critical care environments, patients are exposed to potentially damaging cerebral hypoxia that could likely be prevented if recognized.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The following is a table that details a sampling of observational studies that show the percentage of patients who suffered from cerebral desaturation events (CDEs) as variously defined in each publication:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<TABLE ID="003F622F48F841719C104544CC28F722" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; BORDER-TOP: MEDIUM NONE; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; BORDER-RIGHT: MEDIUM NONE; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: MEDIUM NONE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="4" BORDER="0">

</DIV>

</DIV>

</DIV>

</DIV>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID; WIDTH: 70.15%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM: MEDIUM NONE; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Casati A, et.al.

<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	This and a growing body of clinical evidence substantiates the premise that measuring cerebral oximetry offers valuable insight to clinicians during the management of critical care patients which could permit them to increase safety, improve clinical outcomes, and reduce costs.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 8 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	The Market for Tissue Oximetry
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cerebral desaturation events occur with much greater frequency than previously believed.&#160; The large and growing body of published literature in support of cerebral oximetry provides a solid academic and data-driven support for the expanded use of the product in a variety of critical care settings including: heart surgery; lung surgery; major vascular surgery; neurosurgery; surgeries that provide a risk of large blood loss, such as orthopedic hip and spine; surgeries on elderly patients or those with compromised vascular systems or other co-morbidities; surgeries with non-supine patient positioning, such as orthopedic "beach chair" shoulder surgery and bariatric surgery; trauma care; cardiac arrest; and intensive care patient management in adult, pediatric, and neonatal wards, among others. Therefore, in the U.S. alone, cerebral monitoring could safeguard millions of patients each year.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	While we believe the eventual addressable market for tissue oximetry exceeds $500 million, we estimate current total worldwide annual sales of tissue oximetry to be approximately $100 million.&#160; Given the broad potential applicability of this parameter and the small current rate of market penetration, we also believe that market rates of growth can accelerate in the foreseeable future, particularly as the use of oximetry moves toward becoming a standard of care.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The literature in support of tissue oximetry, in general, and FORE-SIGHT oximetry, in particular, will play an increasingly important role in the expansion of the tissue oximetry market as clinicians continue to be educated regarding the potential benefits of this parameter.&#160; Consequently, a significant part of our longer-term strategy is to continue to encourage and support research related to the need for cerebral oximetry and its efficacy in improving care.&#160; FORE-SIGHT has already been referenced in hundreds of papers, abstracts, and posters, and the literature in support of the product grows every year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Traditional Monitoring
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In addition to Tissue Oximetry products, CASMED provides vital signs monitoring products, supplies, and services to clinicians around the world.&#160; Those include:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="38D9CFEFBA0547D8A45C6D4EC7423349" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	1)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sales to Original Equipment Manufacturers ("OEM") of the Company's proprietary non-invasive blood pressure technology (MAXNIBP and MAXIQ) for inclusion in the OEM customers' own multi-parameter monitors and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="07B736DABB1345D2ACC4CDA9DE5788C2" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	2)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Supplies and service, including neonatal intensive care disposables supplies (such as electrodes and skin temperature probes). On March 28, 2016, the Company sold the neonatal intensive care supplies product line.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Blood Pressure Measurement Technology
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company has developed a proprietary non-invasive blood pressure measurement technology that it sells under the MAXNIBP and MAXIQ brands.&#160; The Company believes this technology is more accurate, reliable, and able to produce a measurement result faster than its competitors in high-motion environments.&#160; These advantages are important, especially in the most challenging clinical situations where measurements can be difficult to obtain, such as emergency care and when caring for pediatric patients.&#160; The Company has entered into OEM agreements to supply its MAXNIBP and MAXIQ technology to various companies throughout the world.&#160; This technology is used in other monitoring systems where non-invasive blood pressure is one of many measurement parameters.&#160; The Company's OEM relationships are typically multi-year.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Supplies and Service
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	CASMED supplied a line of specialty neonatal supplies, including Klear-Trace&#174;&#160;electrodes and NeoGuard&#174; skin temperature probes, adhesive reflectors, and Limboard&#174; arm boards. These high-quality single-patient-use products are designed specifically to meet the unique needs of neonatal intensive care. On March 28, 2016, the Company sold the neonatal intensive care supplies product line. The Company also provides various repair services to its customers for monitors in place in the field.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Sales and Marketing
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company markets its products globally, through hospital, surgery center and outpatient facility, homecare, veterinary, and emergency medical distribution channels. A number of different sales channels are utilized to maximize opportunities for the various product lines we offer.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 9 -
</FONT>

<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Tissue Oximetry Monitoring
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company's FORE-SIGHT tissue oximeters are sold via a direct sales force, key manufacturer's representatives groups within the U.S., and stocking distribution partners outside the U.S.&#160; As of December 31, 2015, the Company's U.S. sales organization was comprised of one vice president, three regional managers, ten direct sales representatives, two manufacturer's representative organizations, and eight clinical specialists.&#160; The international sales organization included one vice president and three sales consultants located in Europe, the Middle East, and the Pacific Rim, all managing FORE-SIGHT sales through our distribution partners.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company continues to invest significant resources in hiring, engaging, educating, and supporting its FORE-SIGHT field sales organization.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Traditional Monitoring
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company sells its non&#8209;invasive blood pressure technology in the form of sub&#8209;assemblies to be assembled into other OEM companies' multi&#8209;parameter monitors. The Company sells this product line on a direct basis, utilizing headquarters-based employees to solicit companies operating in both the domestic and international markets.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sales of the Company's neonatal supplies are primarily sold via key stocking distribution partners in the U.S.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Competition
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company competes in the broader medical equipment market for patient monitoring equipment and supplies. We believe that our reputation for producing innovative, accurate, and reliable products that are user-friendly and contain best-in-class technology are key factors in our ability to successfully compete with larger organizations in the medical products market.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We believe that the principal competitive factors that our company and other companies competing in our markets face are:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="32D3AA80058046D3BD121D3C0987DB0E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Competitors for our Tissue Oximetry products include Covidien, Ornim, Masimo, Hutchinson Technology, Nonin Medical, and Hamamatsu.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Competitors for our Traditional Monitoring products are myriad and include large corporations such as the SunTech Medical Division of Halma, Inc., Omron Corp., and Mindray in the OEM NIBP market.&#160; Many of the major patient monitoring solutions companies also have their own proprietary NIBP technology.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our R&amp;D efforts in 2015 were primarily focused on expanding the applications for our FORE-SIGHT ELITE monitor, reducing FORE-SIGHT ELITE sensor manufacturing costs and advancing the design and the performance of our MAXNIBP non-invasive blood pressure technology.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During 2015 and 2014, the Company incurred R&amp;D expenses of approximately $3,514,000 and $3,316,000, or 16% and 17% of sales, respectively. The higher R&amp;D expenses in 2015 were caused by increased salaries and related benefits partially due to a slight increase in personnel and lower state R&amp;D tax credits.
</DIV>
<DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Certificates of Registration have been issued to the Company by the United States Patent and Trademark Office for the following marks:&#160; CAS
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, CASMED
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, FORE-SIGHT
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, FORE-SIGHT
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#160;
</SUP>
	ELITE
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, COOL-LIGHT
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, For Every Life and Breath Situation
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	,&#160;For What's Vital
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, HOLD-TIGHT
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, LASER-SIGHT
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	, and MAXNIBP
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	&#174;
</SUP>
	.&#160; In addition, the Company has pending trademark applications.&#160;&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company holds 15 U.S. patents and 15 non-U.S. patents and has multiple pending patent applications for its FORE-SIGHT technologies which it believes provide it with a competitive market advantage.&#160; The Company believes the design concepts covered in its patents, patent applications, and provisional patent applications are important to providing a tissue oximeter capable of absolute tissue oxygen saturation measurements with the FORE-SIGHT oximeter level of accuracy. Although the Company holds such patents and has patents pending related to certain products, it does not believe that its business as a whole is significantly dependent upon patent protection.&#160; The Company also relies on trade secret, copyright, and other laws and on confidentiality agreements to protect its technology.&#160; The Company has copyright protection for the software used in its blood pressure and tissue oximeter monitors.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company will continue to seek patent, trademark, and copyright protections as it deems advisable to protect the markets for its products and its R&amp;D efforts.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Employees
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company had 101 employees of which 98 were full-time.&#160; The Company has no collective bargaining agreements and believes that relations with its employees are good.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Government Regulation
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Medical products of the type currently being marketed and under development by the Company are subject to regulation under the Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act (the "FD&amp;C Act") and numerous acts and amendments such as the Quality System Regulations ("QSR"), often referred to as Good Manufacturing Practices ("GMP").
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In addition, depending upon product type, the Company must also comply with those regulations governing the Conduct of Human Investigations, Pre&#8209;Market Notification Regulations, and other requirements, as promulgated by the FDA.&#160; The FDA is authorized to inspect a device, its labeling and advertising, and the facilities in which it is manufactured, in order to ensure that the device is not manufactured or labeled in a manner which could cause it to be in violation of the FD&amp;C Act.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 11 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The FDA has adopted regulations which classify medical devices based upon the degree of regulation believed necessary to assure safety and efficacy.&#160; A device is classified as a Class I, II, or III device.&#160; Class I devices are subject only to general controls.&#160; Class II devices, in addition to general controls, are or will be subject to "performance standards."&#160; Most devices are also subject to the 510(k) pre&#8209;market notification provision.&#160; In addition, some Class III devices require FDA pre&#8209;market studies before they may be marketed commercially because their safety and effectiveness cannot be assured by the general controls and performance standards of Class I or II devices.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company's products are primarily Class I and II devices, and most require FDA clearance under Section 510(k) of the FD&amp;C Act.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In the last factory inspection of the Company by the FDA during March 2013, no material non-conformities were observed.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	International Regulatory Compliance
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	CASMED maintains certification to ISO 13485:2003 by the Notified Body, BSI Inc., for its manufacturing facility. These certifications and compliance with the Medical Device Directive allow CASMED to use the "CE" mark on its products.&#160; The CE mark is required for medical devices to gain access to the European Union ("EU") common market and other non-EU markets as well.&#160; The FDA, recognizing the value of this universally accepted quality system, has patterned its Quality System Regulations after ISO 9001 and ISO 13485. CASMED maintains full compliance with ISO 13485:2003 and the EU's Medical Device Directive, as evaluated by annual assessment.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<U>
	Manufacturing and Quality Assurance
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company assembles, tests, or packages its products at its facility in Branford, Connecticut.&#160; The various components for the products, which include plastic moldings, wire, printed circuit boards, sub-assemblies, and many other parts, are obtained from outside vendors.&#160; The Company has not experienced any sustained interruption in production or the supply of components and does not anticipate any difficulties in obtaining the components necessary to manufacture its products.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Quality assurance procedures are performed by the Company at its Branford, Connecticut, facility and occasionally at its suppliers' facilities to standards set forth in the FDA's "Quality System Regulations."&#160; These procedures include the initial qualification of the supplier, inspection of components, and full testing of finished goods.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Customers
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Our five largest customers accounted for approximately 23% and 24% of sales from continuing operations in 2015 and 2014, respectively.&#160; Among these customers,
</FONT>
	Physio-Control, Inc. accounted for 11% of sales from continuing operations during each of 2015 and 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Backlog
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company's backlog includes orders pursuant to long-term OEM agreements as well as orders for products shippable on a current basis. Total backlog, therefore, is not a meaningful indicator of the Company's future sales.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">

</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	CAS Medical Systems, Inc. is a Delaware corporation organized in 1984. Our corporate offices are located at 44 East Industrial Road, Branford, CT 06405, and our telephone number is (203) 488-6056. Our website address is

</EFX_BUSINESS>
<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Item 1A.&#160; Risk Factors
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our business faces many risks.&#160; If any of the events or circumstances described in the following risk factors actually occurs, our business, financial condition, or results of operations could suffer, and the trading price of our common stock could decline.&#160; The risks described below may not be the only risks we face.&#160; Additional risks that we do not yet know of or that we currently believe are immaterial may also impair our business operations.&#160; You should consider the following risks, as well as the other information included or incorporated by reference in this Form 10-K, before deciding to invest in our common stock.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We have a recent history of net losses and are subject to risks regarding future liquidity.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We have experienced operating losses during our last eight fiscal years.&#160; The net loss applicable to common stockholders was $8,282,000 for the 2015 calendar year, and the accumulated deficit was $37,929,000 as of December 31, 2015.&#160; The Company does not anticipate a return to operating profits in the near-term, and there can be no assurance that we will be able to improve our results of operations in the near-term or at all.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company's ordinary short-term capital needs are expected to be met from our cash-on-hand which was supplemented by net proceeds of approximately $8,517,000 from a public offering of our common stock consummated on February 17, 2015, and amounts available under the revolving credit agreement with our lender. In addition, on March 28, 2016, the Company sold its neonatal intensive care disposables product line for $3,350,000 of consideration, including $3,035,000 paid in cash at closing.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cash flows may be impacted by a number of factors, including changing market conditions, market acceptance of the FORE-SIGHT system, and the loss of one or more key customers. There can be no assurance that we will be successful in raising additional capital if the need arises.&#160; The failure to raise any necessary additional capital on acceptable terms, or at all, could have a material adverse effect on our business and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We are a small company in a highly competitive industry.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Competition from other medical device companies, diversified healthcare companies, and research and academic institutions is intense and expected to increase.&#160; Many companies engaged in the medical device sector have substantially greater financial and other resources and development capabilities than we do and have substantially greater experience in testing products, obtaining regulatory approvals, and manufacturing, marketing, and distributing medical devices.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Other companies may succeed in developing and commercializing products earlier than we do.&#160; In addition to competing with universities and other research institutions in the development of products, technologies, and processes, the Company may compete with other companies in acquiring rights to products or technologies from universities.&#160; Also, the medical device market is experiencing increasing customer concentration, due to the emergence of large purchasing groups and hospital systems.&#160; We cannot assure you that we will develop products that are more effective or achieve greater market acceptance than competitive products or that our competitors will not succeed in developing products and technologies that are more effective than those being developed by us or that would render our products and technologies less competitive or obsolete.&#160; Moreover, there can be no assurance that we will be able to successfully sell to large purchasing groups, which are increasingly looking to suppliers that can provide a broader range of products than we currently offer.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Our business is materially and increasingly dependent on our FORE-SIGHT tissue oximetry products.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sales of our FORE-SIGHT tissue oximetry products represented approximately 71% of our 2015 net sales from continuing operations, up from 65% during 2014.&#160; Our business strategy in recent years has been to transform CASMED from a low-margin commodity capital medical equipment business into a high-growth, high-margin medical disposables business.&#160; A key aspect of this strategy has been to focus on the growth of our FORE-SIGHT tissue oximetry products, while exiting or de-emphasizing our other various lines of business.&#160; However, the relative growth of FORE-SIGHT results in additional concentration risks.&#160; In the absence of significant other lines of business, we are subject to a greater degree on the success of our FORE-SIGHT tissue oximetry products.&#160; Any adverse business or other events relating to our FORE-SIGHT tissue oximetry products, including those described elsewhere in this Item 1A, will result in a proportionately greater potential negative impact on our business and financial condition.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 13 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage14"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our business is impacted by customer concentration.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company's five largest customers accounted for approximately 23% and 24% of sales from continuing operations in 2015 and 2014, respectively.&#160; Among these customers,
</FONT>
	Physio-Control, Inc. accounted for 11% of such sales during each of 2015 and 2014. The loss of any significant customer could have a material adverse effect on our financial position and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	We are devoting substantial resources to the development and marketing of our tissue oximetry products.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We expect to devote a significant amount of resources to continue the development and marketing of our FORE-SIGHT tissue oximetry products. We believe that substantial additional resources are required to further penetrate the markets for these products.&#160; Such investments include further research and development, including significant expenditures for clinical studies, equipment for placements at customer sites, further expansion of our selling organization, marketing expenditures, and general working capital requirements. There can be no assurance that we will be successful in these endeavors.&#160; In addition, since we have limited financial resources, our emphasis on FORE-SIGHT tissue oximetry products may result in a lack of sufficient resources for our other product lines, which may negatively impact our overall financial results.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The sale of our products may result in significant product liability exposure.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As a manufacturer of medical equipment and products, we face product liability claims.&#160; We maintain product liability insurance in an aggregate amount of $5 million.&#160; We cannot assure you that this insurance coverage will be adequate to cover any product liability claims that occur in the future or that product liability insurance will continue to be available at reasonable prices.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	Any product liability judgments or settlements in excess of insurance coverage could have a material adverse effect on our business and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our business could be adversely affected if we cannot protect our proprietary technology or if we infringe on the proprietary technology of others.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our proprietary technology aids our ability to compete effectively with other companies in certain markets in which we compete. Although we have been awarded or have filed applications for numerous patents, these patents may not fully protect our technology or competitive position. Further, our competitors may apply for and obtain patents that will restrict our ability to make and sell our products.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our competitors may intentionally infringe our patents. Third parties may also assert infringement claims against us. Litigation may be necessary to enforce patents issued to us, to protect our trade secrets or know-how, to defend ourselves against claimed infringement of the rights of others, or to determine the scope and validity of the proprietary rights of others. The defense and prosecution of patent suits are both costly and time-consuming, even if the outcome is favorable to us. Such proceedings can be extremely expensive, and their outcome very unpredictable.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	An adverse outcome in the defense of a patent suit could cause us to lose proprietary rights, subject us to significant liabilities to third parties or require us to license rights from third parties or to cease selling our products. Any of these events could have a material adverse effect on our business, operating results, and financial condition.&#160;&#160; We also rely on unpatented proprietary technology that others may independently develop or otherwise obtain access to.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our inability to maintain the proprietary nature of our technologies could negatively affect our sales and earnings.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Cost-containment efforts of our customers, purchasing groups, third-party payors, and governmental organizations could adversely affect our sales and profitability.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Many existing and potential customers for our products within the United States have become members of group purchase organizations (GPOs) and integrated delivery networks (IDNs) in an effort to reduce costs. GPOs and IDNs negotiate pricing arrangements with healthcare product manufacturers and distributors and offer the negotiated prices to affiliated hospitals and other members. GPOs and IDNs typically award contracts on a category-by-category basis through a competitive bidding process. Bids are generally solicited from multiple manufacturers with the intention of driving down pricing. Due to the highly competitive nature of the GPO and IDN contracting processes, we may not be able to obtain or maintain contract positions with major GPOs and IDNs across our product portfolio. Furthermore, the increasing leverage of organized buying groups may reduce market prices for our products, thereby reducing our profitability.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 14 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage15"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	While having a contract with a GPO or IDN for a given product category can facilitate sales to members of that GPO or IDN, such contract positions can offer no assurance that sales volumes of those products will be maintained. GPOs and IDNs increasingly are awarding contracts to multiple suppliers for the same product category. Even when we are the sole contracted supplier of a GPO or IDN for a certain product category, members of the GPO or IDN generally are free to purchase from other suppliers. Furthermore, GPO and IDN contracts typically are terminable without cause upon notice of 60 to 90 days. Accordingly, the members of such groups may choose to purchase from our competitors due to the price or quality offered by such competitors, which could result in a decline in our sales and profitability.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Distributors of our products and hospital purchasers negotiate terms of sale aggressively to increase their profitability. Reductions in our average selling prices or failure to negotiate arrangements having advantageous pricing and other terms of sale could adversely affect our business, results of operations, financial condition, and cash flows.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Outside the United States, we have experienced pricing pressure from centralized governmental healthcare authorities and increased efforts by such authorities to lower healthcare costs. We frequently are required to engage in competitive bidding for the sale of our products to governmental purchasing agents. Our failure to offer acceptable prices to these customers could adversely affect our sales and profitability in these markets.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Defects or failures associated with our products could lead to recalls or safety alerts and negative publicity.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Manufacturing flaws, component failures, design defects, off-label uses, or inadequate disclosure of product-related information could result in an unsafe condition or the injury or death of a patient. These problems could lead to a recall of, or issuance of a safety alert relating to, our products and result in significant costs and negative publicity. Due to the strong name recognition of our brands, an adverse event involving one of our products could result in reduced market acceptance and demand for all products within that brand and could harm our reputation and our ability to market our products in the future. In some circumstances, adverse events arising from or associated with the design, manufacture, or marketing of our products could result in the suspension or delay of regulatory reviews of our applications for new product approvals. We also may undertake a voluntary recall of products or temporarily shut down production lines based on performance relative to our own internal safety and quality monitoring and testing data. Any of the foregoing problems could disrupt our business and have a material effect on our business, results of operations, financial condition, and cash flows.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We depend on distributors for a substantial portion of our sales. Failure to establish and maintain relationships with distributors could materially and adversely affect our business, financial condition, and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We depend on distributors for a substantial percentage of our sales. Certain of our distribution agreements may contain terms that are not favorable to us, and as our existing distribution agreements expire, we may be unable to renew with our desired distributors on favorable terms or at all. Furthermore, competition for distributors is intense. We compete for distributors domestically and internationally with other leading medical equipment and device companies that may have higher visibility, greater name recognition and financial resources, and a broader product selection than we do. Our competitors also often enter into long-term distribution agreements that effectively prevent their distributors from selling our products. At times, we may also become engaged in contract disputes or other negotiations with distributors. Consequently, establishing relationships with new distributors, maintaining relationships with existing distributors, and replacing distributors may be difficult and time consuming. Any disruption of our distribution network, including our failure to renew distribution agreements at favorable terms or our failure to successfully negotiate contract disputes, could negatively affect our ability to effectively sell our products and could materially and adversely affect our business, financial condition, and results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	If we are unable to effectively structure and manage our distribution network, actions taken by our distributors could harm our corporate image and cause us to fail to meet our sales goals.
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL; FONT-STYLE: NORMAL">
	- 15 -
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage16"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	We have limited ability to manage the activities of our independent distributors. Our distributors could take one or more of the following actions, some of which we have previously experienced and any of which could have a material adverse effect on our business, prospects, and brand:
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="F6D567E67D9E48198DEA0F880C8B8E24" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	sell products that compete with products that they have contracted to sell for us;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="0002DB471F2247A69F6A32BA1C65E268" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	sell our products outside of our pricing guidelines, distorting the market price of our products;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="EED812DA2CAC44D382EA8B43990C0C4C" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>

</DIV>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	sell our products outside their designated territory or to non-authorized end-users, possibly in violation of the exclusive distribution rights of other distributors;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="B522504C50194C6583326A672FA82034" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">

</DIV>

	directly or indirectly distribute products lacking necessary U.S. certifications into the U.S. market in violation of applicable U.S. law;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="E1B87EC30A764169A3A12F2DFAFC286B" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">

</DIV>
